On 12/18/2005 05:11 PM, J. B. Rainsberger apparently said:

> jason r tibbetts wrote:
> > Jason Rogers wrote:
> >  > On 12/16/2005 11:20 AM, jason r tibbetts apparently said:
> >  >
> >  >
> >  >>I've been on an XDoclet kick lately, and I'm considering writing a
> >  >>custom XDoclet task that will automatically generate an AllTests 
> class
> >  >>for each package. Has anyone already done this, or is there a 
> similar,
> >  >>non-XDoclet solution? It can be easily done by any scripting 
> language,
> >  >>but I have an ulterior motive to using XDoclet--I'm looking for a 
> simple
> >  >>example to use in tutorials and presentations.
> >  >
> >  >
> >  > JUnit-Addons has the DirectoryBuilder which we use on our 
> projects.  It
> >  > doesn't produce an AllTests class but it produces a suite on the fly.
> >
> > I use junit-addons, but I hadn't paid much attention to that class
> > before. But you'd still have to create an AllTests class and use the
> > DirectorySuiteBuilder to create the suite()'s return value, and I'm too
> > lazy to do even that for each package that I create.
>
> Why do it per package? Do it once for the whole project.
>
> That said, I've never seen an XDoclet solution to generating AllTests.

We do it on a per project basis.  If you are interested in the few lines 
of code we use to do this let me know.

--
